frameDefinitions: A Money_owner exchanges Sum_1 in the  Source_currency for Sum_2 in the Target_currency at some Exchange_service.
This scenario describes a series of Events, associated with a single Participant, i.e., the history of the Participant.
An Executive_authority exchanges one penalty, the Original_punishment, for another less severe one, the New_punishment.
In this frame, an Agent or Cause changes the duration of an Event.

Because it no longer functions adequately under the given circumstances, an Agent (or non-Agentive Cause) undertakes steps to change the structural makeup of a complex Entity with interdependent parts, for instance an institution or a system of laws.
The action of an Agent or the occurrence of a Cause event returns an Entity to an earlier  state of vigor and strength.
frameExamples: After checking into the Intourist-operated $30-a-day Hotel Zerafshon, we each <t>exchanged</t> $50 for Uzbek currency with a shifty loiterer in the lobby at the rate .
We've been worried about our recent hire's <t><fex name='Events'>history</fex></t> of deceiving employers.
On December 15, 1971, Governor Winfield Dunn conditionally <t>commuted</t> his sentence to twenty years.
Don't let him <t>prolong</t> the discussion to an absurd length.
They want to <t>reform</t> the law on Sunday trading.
Falling prices and wireless connectivity have <t>breathed new life</t> into the PDA market.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who exchanges <fen>Sum_1</fen> for <fen>Sum_2</fen>.
An amount of money in the <fen>Source_currency</fen> that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> exchanges for an amount in the <fen>Target_currency</fen>.
The kind of currency of the <fen>Money_owner</fen> has before the exchange.
The amount of money in the <fen>Target_currency</fen> that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> receives in exchange for <fen>Sum_1</fen>.
The kind of currency that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> receives as part of the exchange.
Currency that is being exchanged by the <fen>Money_owner</fen>.
The time when the currency is exchanged.
The location where the money is exchanged.

The <fen>Participant</fen> is either an active participant in all of the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Agent or Patient), or is more peripherally associated with the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Location or Topic).
The <fen>Events</fen> which the <fen>Participant</fen> is a part of. This role is used to mark the frame-evoking element.
When the <fen>Events</fen> concerning the <fen>Participant</fen> occured.
The constitutionally specified authority who has the power to commute punishments.
The punishment the <fen>Offender</fen> was originally sentenced to.
The time at which the <fen>Original_punishment</fen>  is commuted.
The location where the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> commutes the <fen>Original_punishment</fen>.
The sentient entity that changes the duration of the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen>'s duration is changed.
An event that causes the change in Event duration.
The time at which the change in duration of the Event is caused.
The sentient entity that effects a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.

This role denotes a complex, abstract, human-created entity with interdependent parts which has either deteriorated or is no longer adequate for its purpose given a change in circumstances and which the <fen>Agent</fen> therefore wants to modify.
This role is for non-human causes, such as a processes or institutions, responsible for reform.
The time at which the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
The place where the reformation occurs.
The concrete or abstract thing that is brought into an earlier state in which it was more effective and powerful.
The <fen>Agent</fen> puts the <fen>Entity</fen> into a state of renewed vigor.
An event or state whose occurrence brings about the <fen>Entity</fen>'s return to a vigorous state.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the renewal of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the Agent brings about the change in the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Kornfeldt</fex> hurried through customs, grabbed a city map at a tourist information desk, changed $40 USD into about 300 Hong Kong dollars before leaving the airport
I said forget it and just exchanged <fex>$40 US cash</fex> into $47 and change in Canadian.
We stopped at a bank were we exchanged <fex>Euros</fex> for Danish money.
On the bus we exchanged $50 <fex>for 1410 rubles</fex>.
We had exchanged $100 <fex>into francs</fex> in LAX to be able to pay for the cab ride upon arrival.
I exchanged $1000 <fex>of my money</fex> at the bank.
We walked around Eyre Square and exchanged money <fex>before walking into Taaffes pub and grabbing my first draught pint of Guinness of the trip</fex>.
I exchanged $100 <fex>in Croatia</fex> because i needed a round trip bus ticket to sarajevo.
We've been worried about <fex>our recent hire's</fex> history of deceiving employers.
We will focus on events in her recent <fex>history</fex>.
Hearst was sentenced to seven years in prison. 1979, <fex>President Jimmy Carter</fex> commuted Hearst's prison sentence after she served nearly two years.
I had learned after all of this period of time has passed the court was about to let (Bush) pay a sum of money and commute <fex>her sentence</fex> to time served.
Israel <fex>yesterday</fex> commuted the lengthy prison terms of seven Jews convicted of murdering or plotting to kill Arabs.
Don't let <fex>him</fex> prolong the discussion to an absurd length.
Don't let him prolong <fex>the discussion</fex> to an absurd length.
<fex>Rain</fex> so cruelly cut short the game against Bangladesh.
<fex>Last week</fex>, he unnecessarily prolonged the agony, thinking that he could tough it out.
Particular attention will be devoted to recent proposals to reform <fex>UK competition policy</fex>.
Thus , <fex>radical reform</fex> restructures rape offences in ways that it is hoped will facilitate the prosecution process without jeopardising the interests of the accused .
The House of Representatives, on a bipartisan basis, sought to reform the program <fex>this year</fex>.
The reinvigoration <fex>of the tourism</fex> economy is recognised by many as an ambitious but necessary objective.
<fex>We</fex> revitalized the Golden Mountaineer Card, and we gave seniors a prescription drug benefit.
Rock has been rejuvenated creatively and commercially <fex>by hip-hop-inspired rock acts</fex>.
Production was revitalized <fex>last June</fex>.

New York's distinction as America's tax cut leader has revitalized the economy
<fex>in every corner of the state</fex>.
